questions.question_text:
A user from an organization is unable to log in to Prisma Cloud Console after having logged in the previous day.

Which area on the Console will provide input on this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

A

See the below Doc STEP 2_O (15):
Using View last SSO login failures, you can see details of last five login issues or errors for SSO authentication for any users.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/manage-prisma-cloud-administrators/setup-sso-integration-on-prisma-cloud/setup-sso-integration-on-prisma-cloud-for-okta

Selected Answer: B
B

"We don't have much information about the issue, but we can rule out option B. We need to check the audit logs to see if there have been any changes to the configuration. In the previous days, the user was able to log in."

Selected Answer: A
AB

When you create an access key, the key is tied to the role with which you logged in and if you delete the role, the access key is automatically deleted.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/manage-prisma-cloud-administrators/create-access-keys

AB
"If you delete a role, the access keys associated with the role are automatically deleted, and any integrations that use the access key to make calls to Prisma Cloud will stop working."
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/manage-prisma-cloud-administrators/create-access-keys

Selected Answer: A
A B
"If you delete a role, the access keys associated with the role are automatically deleted,
and any integrations that use the access key to make calls to Prisma Cloud will stop
working"

questions.question_text: What happens when a role is deleted in Prisma Cloud?

choices.D: Any user who uses that key will be deleted.
choices.A: The access key associated with that role is automatically deleted.
choices.B: Any integrations that use the access key to make calls to Prisma Cloud will stop working.
choices.C: The users associated with that role will be deleted.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C

the default when using the script is twistlock, but you can use whatever you want.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/configure/set_diff_paths_daemon_sets

questions.question_text: What is the default namespace created by Defender DaemonSet during deployment?
Which three OWASP protections are part of Prisma Cloud Web-Application and API Security (WAAS) rule? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
The following types of attacks are included in the OWASP TOP 10:

• C. SQL injection
• D. Local file inclusion
• E. Shellshock
DoS detection is an additional feature of WAAS, but it is not the core of the OWASP TOP 10

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE

https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/images/prisma/owasp-top-10-protection-2.png?imwidth=3840

OWASP Top-10 Coverage - Protection against most critical security risks to web applications, including injection flaws, broken authentication, broken access control, security misconfigurations, etc.
